alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN DELAWARE AND NORTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ashley, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Sunbury, Ashley, Galena, Hartford, Interstate 71 at US Route 36/State Route 37, Alum Creek State Park, Leonardsburg, Olive Green and Kilbourne. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 124 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
